Today the House Judiciary Committee held a hearing to permanently authorize and fund H.R. 1327, the Never Forget the Heroes: Permanent Authorization of the Sept 11th VCF, of which I am a cosponsor.
#Renew911VCF

Truly sobering and humbling.

I have not even been here for 24 hours and cannot emphasize enough what a stunningly powerful experience this has been.

I also had an opportunity to meet with the future Chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, Army Chief of Staff Gen. Mark Milley and the National Commander of the American Legion, Brett Reistad. pic.twitter.com/kPuAyUTeaI
After this morning's ceremonies, I visited the American Cemetery in Colleville-sur-Mer, where I will return tomorrow to pay my respects at the graves of 21 soldiers from my district interred there.

More than 10,000 people attended this morning's ceremony. To see them all rise in unison in honor of the veterans who served and sacrificed was powerful.

I will continue to share updates, photos, and videos of this trip over the next few days.
Arriving in Normandy by helicopter this morning, 75 years after D-Day, I was struck by the magnitude of this view of the beaches and cliffs at Omaha Beach. pic.twitter.com/CHmimrN2of
